Text: Echinacea is a genus, or group of herbaceous flowering plants in the daisy family.

2: moist to dry prairies and open wooded areas

--------------------
Text: Echinacea:  They are found only in eastern and central North America, where they are found growing in moist to dry prairies and open wooded areas.

Text: Echinacea:  The generic name is derived from the Greek word ἐχῖνος ("ekhinos"), meaning "hedgehog," due to the spiny central disk.
